content: Made my job easier Likes: I organize almost everything in my life—from work tasks and documentation to my personal to-do lists. One of the many things I love about Notion is how every feature is simplified; nothing is complex or requires tech-savviness. I've never needed to contact customer support since I haven't encountered any major issues that prevented me from doing my job. Any challenges I face are more about my own learning curve. I love Notion and use it every day, especially since I rely on it not just for work, but also to keep track of important things in my life. When I first started using Notion, I had a few feature requests that I submitted through their feedback pop-ups. Surprisingly, after a few months, they released these features, which made integrating Notion into my team's workflow even easier. Dislikes: There's nothing I dislike about Notion, really—I just wish columns within callout boxes were possible! Problems Solved: Organization and documentation management—It's been wonderful to consolidate our documentation and tasks in Notion, with seamless linking between items. This has made it easier to handle staff turnover and onboard new team members to use Notion for work.

content: Notion is the ultimate all-in-one hub for my type-A brain Likes: Notion is the ultimate all-in-one hub for my type-A brain because it allows me to organize, track, and plan with complete precision. I love how everything I need—tasks, notes, calendars (even sync my G-cal!), and databases—can be brought together in one place. It's the perfect tool for someone like me who thrives on structure and order. The customization options let me create systems that align perfectly with my workflow, and I can break things down into manageable chunks with all the color-coding and tagging I could ever want. Dislikes: That level of control is key for me because it helps me stay on top of everything, whether it’s work, personal goals, or anything in between. But sometimes, I can get a little too carried away with the endless possibilities for customization. I have to remind myself not to overcomplicate things because, with my perfectionist tendencies, I can easily find myself overthinking or getting bogged down by decision fatigue. Problems Solved: I love how everything I need—tasks, notes, calendars, and databases—can be brought together in one place. It's the perfect tool for someone like me who thrives on structure and order.

content: Notion é uma boa ferramenta para organização de trabalho e estudos Likes: Uso o Notion como ferramenta para trabalho e estudos. Consigo criar pastas e páginas através da interface simples e bonita que ele possui e personalizá-las da forma que acho necessário, inserindo textos, imagens, tabelas, lista e vários outros elementos. Para mim, essa capacidade de "montar" os documentos como desejo e de maneira simplificada é o que mais me atrai no aplicativo. O Notion possui várias alternativas para acelerar o fluxo de trabalho, como a opção de utilizar o atalho do teclado "/" para encontrar o sistema simplificado de blocos de opções. Essas e outras funcionalidades me atraem bastante, já que não preciso perder tempo procurando onde estão as funções que desejo inserir na minha página naquele momento específico. Comecei a usar o Notion de verdade durante o meu trabalho de conclusão de curso na faculdade de Jornalismo. Para essa tarefa, ele funcionou como um centralizador de documentos e referências, onde eu e meu colega conseguíamos compartilhar artigos, atas, pautas, referências e outros documentos para a execução do trabalho. Além disso, também criamos uma lista de "para fazer" para acompanhar o desenvolvimento de cada tarefa que compunha o trabalho. Com isso, além de melhorar a visualização de todo o processo, o Notion nos ajudou a determinar uma ordem de prioridade que fizesse sentido para uma melhor evolução do trabalho. A implementação e integração foram simples e diretas. A partir disso, passei a utilizar o Notion como ferramenta para outros estudos, usando o app, basicamente, como uma plataforma de anotações e um centralizador de documentos. Dislikes: Pessoalmente, ainda não encontrei coisas que desgosto dentro do Notion. Ele me atende bem no que preciso dele e ainda preciso explorar um pouco mais do aplicativo para talvez encontrar algum defeito. Hoje, não tenho contras para mencionar. Problems Solved: O Notion me ajuda a administrar diferentes setores da vida. Nos estudos, posso fazer anotações de cursos que faço e separá-las facilmente de acordo com a área do curso, como marketing, SEO ou desing. No trabalho, uso para organizar documentos, escrever posts e desenvolver ideias em mapas mentais.

content: The software I go to organize my life Likes: Notion has revolutionized how I organize my life, that's why I use it everyday. I love its versatility — I usually use it as a note taking, studying board, planner and I even to organize my financial life - it is all my life in one place. The ease of creating pages, linking databases and creating boards makes it incredibly intuitive. It's beautiful and me as a designer, love to use it. After you use for the first time, you get better how it works and it feels more intuitive. Also, whenever I need support, I can get in touch with the team and they solve the problem in a quickly and careful way. Dislikes: While Notion is nearly perfect, I find that some of its features have a learning curve, especially for beginners trying to harness its full potential. But, as I mentioned, you can get it in few days, when you are used to. Problems Solved: Notion solves several issues that I face in my daily life. Before Notion, I used multiple tools to manage different aspects of my life — notes, tasks, projects, and calendar. Now, I have it all in one place. Notion allows me to organize things my way, creating my templates and everything. Its boards, tables, and kanban views make managing my life easier.

content: Organization is assurance Likes: Like many young people in their early twenties, I try to embrace the world in just 24 hours: gym, college, work, friends, and family are just a few of the many topics I have to think about daily. Because of this, it's easy to experience feelings of lack of control and anxiety. Notion was my best choice, as it helps me visualize my routine and organize everything in the best possible way. Notion is an extension of my mind; when it fails and I get lost in my routine, it saves me. Dislikes: I wish Notion were integrated with other apps and could communicate with other people's calendars to find common available times. This way, there could be an option where I ask Notion to identify the best day to meet a specific group of friends or schedule a meeting, for example. Problems Solved: Notion helps me overcome my difficulty in organizing a balanced and healthy routine. Especially during stressful moments, it ensures I don't forget my tasks.

content: A Lifesaver for Our Team’s Productivity & Organization! Likes: Notion has revolutionized how we work! From managing projects to creating knowledge bases and tracking tasks, it’s become the backbone of our company’s operations. The flexibility to customize templates and create workflows tailored to our needs is unparalleled. It’s a tool that truly adapts to you, not the other way around. Highly recommend it for teams looking for an all-in-one solution to stay organized and productive! Dislikes: One common critique of Notion is its offline functionality. While it’s an incredibly powerful tool when online, the limited offline access can be frustrating, especially when you need to access or edit critical information without a stable internet connection. Problems Solved: Notion solves the problem of scattered information and inefficiency by providing a centralized platform for managing all aspects of your company’s operations. It consolidates project management, documentation, task tracking, and team collaboration into one highly customizable tool. This eliminates the need for multiple apps, saving time and ensuring everyone stays on the same page.

content: I use Notion everyday and it changes everything in my routine Likes: I really appreciate the endless possibilities for customization that Notion offers. It allows me to organize multiple areas of my life—professional, academic, and personal—all in one place. I find it very useful and rely on it daily for my tasks and projects. It has a wide range of tools and features that make it versatile and adaptable to different needs. Dislikes: While Notion offers a lot, I do find it difficult to integrate it smoothly with other tools, like Google Calendar. Additionally, the learning curve can be steep, especially when trying to set up complex systems. I feel that the platform could benefit from better support to help users get the most out of its features. The process can also become challenging for more advanced tasks. Problems Solved: Notion is helping me save a lot of time by providing ready-to-use templates for new clients, activities, tasks, and projects. This allows me to focus more on the creative aspects of my work, which, as a designer, is the most important part of my business. With Notion, I can keep track of all ongoing projects and prioritize the tasks that need attention daily. Having everything organized in one place also reduces my stress; I no longer have to search in multiple locations for client or project information, which makes my workflow much smoother and more efficient.

Notion A.I is extremely powerful for improving writing. I find that the pages load very quickly; if I compare it to Sharepoint, for example, there is an enormous difference in loading speed. Dislikes: I find it paradoxically complicated to share content. If I want to share a page with a colleague or friend, I have to authorize them to the page, there is an access request, I don't know. content: I can always count with Notion to keep my day-to-day life in track Likes: Notion has become an indispensable tool in my day-to-day work life. I love how it keeps everything organized and accessible in one place, allowing me to track my tasks, notes, and projects efficiently. The flexibility to customize pages and databases to suit my needs makes it easy to stay on top of my work. Whether I'm managing deadlines, taking quick notes, or planning larger projects, I can always check Notion to see where I stand and what needs my attention. It’s a go-to tool for keeping everything in order, and I feel more productive knowing that I have everything I need right at my fingertips. Dislikes: On the flip side, Notion isn't the most beginner-friendly app, especially for those just starting out with productivity tools. The steep learning curve can be intimidating, as there are so many features and customization options that it’s easy to get overwhelmed. For someone new to organizing their workflow or managing tasks digitally, it can feel like there’s too much going on at once. Setting up basic structures, such as databases or linked pages, can be confusing without prior experience, which may turn off people who just want something simple to use from the get-go. Problems Solved: Before using Notion, I used a mix of apps to manage tasks, notes, and projects. I had one app for to-do lists, another for meeting notes, and yet another for managing longer-term projects. This created a lot of mental clutter, and I constantly found myself jumping between different tools. Notion solves this by consolidating all my information in one place. Whether it's task management, notes, or even brainstorming ideas, I can keep everything in one easy-to-access workspace. This has made my workflow much more efficient. Long-term projects can get messy when using traditional to-do lists or basic project management tools. Notion allows me to break down these projects into smaller, manageable tasks, add deadlines, and visualize them in different formats (e.g., Kanban boards, calendars). This structured approach makes it easier to stay on track and avoid missing important steps or milestones.

Likes: With Notion, we don't need much time to set up parameters and it differs a bit from other competitors that use templates for each type of project. In Notion we can start with a workspace to which we add components or functionalities based on our needs. Dislikes: While I like many of the features like the retractable left side menu and Kanban board, I may find the per-user customization a bit limited for my taste. I also think the 'my profile' options could use more features to create more usability, but that being said, I think Notion is great and teams prefer it for its simplicity and ease of adoption. Problems Solved: With Notion we can keep track of the developments and applications we create at the Institution. We can also make progress reports and keep the entire work team in communication.

content: Notion's blend of simplicity and depth Likes: What I like most about Notion is that it is an all-in-one workspace that excels with its intuitive interface, versatility and powerful database functions. Its user-friendly interface allows you to navigate and customize the platform according to your needs. It's amazing to share information with my colleagues and personalize it. In addition, it has a wide range of templates and customization options, making it adaptable for different use cases. In terms of collaboration and work sharing, Notion facilitates information exchange by allowing team members to share pages, databases and documents. It also offers real-time editing and commenting capabilities, which facilitates teamwork and project progress. At my company, we use it to share the job catalogs, benefits, office policies, etc. Is our primary tool to share information along the company. Finally, Notion's database capabilities enable users to create relational databases, allowing them to effectively manage and organize complex information. Dislikes: Although it is very intuitive, it can have a somewhat high learning curve, especially for users who are new to the platform. In my case, I had to use some YouTube tutorials to be able to use it smoothly. When someone is a new user, we need to spend some time explaining basic usage information, because is not intuitive at first. When you are a more experienced user I think is an amazing tool. In addition, you may experience performance issues with large databases or complex pages, resulting in slow load times and occasional delays. Its offline capabilities are also limited, which can make it difficult to work without a reliable Internet connection. The mobile version of Notion is useful but is missing certain features and may be less intuitive. In addition, for larger teams or companies, Notion's advanced features come at a cost, which can be expensive for startups or small businesses. In addition, Notion's data export options are limited, which can be a drawback for those who need to back up or transfer their information to other systems. Problems Solved: Notion addresses several key issues in managing information and communication in the workplace, providing a great benefit to our company. It helps me share essential information effectively with employees, including company policies, salary structures, job catalogs and employee benefits. This centralized platform ensures that all team members have access to the latest information, promoting transparency and consistency. In addition, Notion's collaboration features allow for real-time updates and feedback, improving overall productivity and alignment within the team. Its intuitive design and customization options make it easy to organize and present information in a clear and accessible way, making it an invaluable tool for managing and disseminating important company information. So it's amazing to have a place where we can share a lot of valuable information, links related, images, videos, etc. So when someone has questions about any policy or process, usually we send the Notion link beside of explaining it every time. I save a lot of time thanks to Notion.

content: The best way to organize your whole life Likes: Notion is a mixture of notebook, spreadsheets, data base, kanban board and almost anything in between these. Problems Solved: Collect my notes, thinkings, documents and other important information in a single versatile space.

content: We finally made organizing work and personal projects intuitive and simple Likes: I like that Notion is so versatile for both individual and teams projects. It’s a simple note taking, task management, database platform that has combined thing so well that it’s made our workflow go much smoother. However, I also like the customisable templates for each project that we have saved a lot of time. One of its featured is being able to integrate with other tools like Slack and Google Drive, everything is stored in one easy access place. Dislikes: Notion is great when you have few databases or smaller pages with little content, but as your databases grow or you add a lot of content, it can be slow to load, sometimes affecting our productivity. They also have the problem of being too flexible, which is an issue for new users, as it can be overloading for them to get their head around all of the features at once. The steep learning curve has disguised how quickly the platform can really be used for team collaboration. Problems Solved: By centralizing everything in the best place, Notion has solved our problems of keeping the information for the project in order. It’s allowed me to stop switching between notes, tasks, document apps, saving me time and eliminating errors. The part of its task management features that we have put to use has helped us to stay on schedule and optimise our workflow, cultivating a better organisation and a more organised team communication.

content: Notion has changed the way I work for the better Likes: Flexibility in how to view data, easy formatting controls for notes, minimal but attractive UI that keeps you coming back. We've gone through so many different tools for tracking tasks, notes, and documentation, and this is the only one that's lived up to its promises. Love the kanban board and calendar views especially for how they've helped me keep organized over the last few years. Dislikes: Sometimes the options can get overwhelming, especially once you start trying to get into granular stuff around relational database entries. It works best when you keep it simple or really carefully design your systems. Too bad you can't share just a specific view of a database with clients without their being able to see the whole thing. Problems Solved: Notion lets you make your own knowledge system, and mix and match notes in with databases that you can view as lists, calendars, kanban boards, timelines, etc. Most project management software is either overly simple, or the complexity is constantly smacking you in the face. Notion tucks the fancy stuff away until you need it. And for note-taking and documentation, Notion gives you just enough control over formatting that you can make it visually interesting and readable, but not so much that you can waste time on layout or styling. Notion helps me get the important stuff done (planning and tracking my tasks, taking notes, organizing documentation) without getting lost in the details.

content: Literal life-saver for me and my ADHD 🧠 Likes: The most helpful thing about this tool is that it emcompasses so many different tools and features that would otherwise cost money if used individually. I use Notion as a second brain, a launchpad where I can conceptualize ideas, organize, and hold myself accountable for seeing projects in both my personal and professional life to fruition. For years I struggled with developing workflows and capturing information, but Notion solves that problem for me by providing a highly customizable hub for myself. Dislikes: The main downside to Notion (IMHO) is that there is a bit of a learning curve, especially if you're not coming from a technical background. The solution can be found in the plethora of online tutorials and premade templates, but I encourage folks to learn how to use Notion so they can really make it work for them. Problems Solved: If you're like me and have an executive dysfunction, Notion can help you capture your thought process and better execute processes. You can also integrate it with other tools which is super helpful.

content: A great tool for team and personal organization Likes: The interface's simple and straightforward layout helps my ability to remain focused without distractions. Additionally, it integrates across all of my devices, making sure that I always have access to my notes and projects, no matter whether I am on my computer or phone. It is similar to having an all-in-one workspace that adjusts to my requirements. Dislikes: The thing I don't like about Notion is that it can feel slow at times, especially when loading complicated sites or working with bigger datasets. Because there are so many personalization possibilities, it can be a little difficult at first. I sometimes feel like I work harder to set up the ideal system than I do to do the tasks at hand. Another problem I have with Notion is its limited offline capabilities, which makes it difficult for me to utilize efficiently when I don't have internet access. Problems Solved: The issue of being confused and needing to manage several tools for various jobs is resolved with Notion. It was challenging to organize everything in one location when I used different apps for notes, to-do lists, project management, and even databases until I started using Notion. All of that is combined by Notion, giving me a single platform to manage both my personal and professional projects with ease. content: A Game-changer Likes: The real game-changer for me was the flexibility. I started by setting up a simple to-do list and quickly moved on to creating detailed project boards for each client. One of my favorite features is the ability to create interconnected databases. For instance, I set up a client database that links directly to individual project pages. This means I can see at a glance which stage each project is at, deadlines, and any outstanding tasks. The collaborative features are stellar too; I’ve been able to share specific pages with clients for feedback, and they can leave comments directly on the document. The integration with Google Drive has also been a lifesaver, making it easy to pull in assets and resources. Dislikes: But it’s not all sunshine and rainbows. The learning curve was definitely steeper than I anticipated. The sheer amount of customization options was a bit overwhelming at first, and it took some time to figure out how to best structure my workspace. Also, while the desktop version is fantastic, the mobile app leaves much to be desired. I often found it clunky and less intuitive, which made on-the-go updates a bit frustrating. Performance can also dip when loading particularly large pages or databases, which was a minor annoyance. Problems Solved: When I first stumbled upon Notion, I wasn’t quite sure what to expect. It felt like yet another productivity tool promising the world. But after a few weeks of using it, I can honestly say it’s become an indispensable part of my daily routine. As a designer juggling multiple client projects and personal tasks, I needed something that could keep everything in one place without overwhelming me. Notion delivered in spades.

content: Build your own workflow Likes: The fact that when you log in, every page is empty and there is no HUD with a zillion buttons, instead you have to very consciously recall features, makes you think about the design of the workspace that you want to create. This makes the process of setting up the workflow slow in the beginning but very intentional. It is very good for people, teams and workspaces that are still trying to figure out what works for them, or where individuals or teams require a degree of autonomy to organize their own workspace on their terms and preferences, or in business environments that demand a lot of agility and iteration. Another thing that i love about notion is its ability to bring in transparency to any workspace by providing what they call a 'single source of truth' through the utilization of relational database management systems (RDBMS) as repositories of files, tasks and units of information. The new features vis-a-vis AI are like steroids to the existing experience. Lastly, I love the clean look and interface, and the ability to compose the workspace just adds a whole new depth to imagining the information architecture of the entire organisational setup. Dislikes: The fact that it has no integrated chat feature or ability to embed video conferencing, makes the entire work conversation incomplete. I have to move to Slack to complete the integration, but like there is a pull out chat/dialogue box for AI features, there should be a chatbox for just text based chat inputs specific to each page, that has visibility to every player that can access the page. It would make the entire experience complete. Problems Solved: - Allows me to create custom workflows - Clean and minimal interface makes it accomodating, anxiety free and less daunting for new users to learn - Notion Academy is a very helpful learning resource that helps the new users understand the use case of Notion rather than just loading their head with features - Allows for a pace that makes the design of organisational structure and information architecture of the workspace very intentional and reasoned - Allows for iteration and composition that is critically missing in other softwares - Allows for data storage and embedding, and with AI that is being given a boost. Again missing in other project management softwares largely, or the ease of use is much less. - Has fostered transparency and communication and reduced errors, double work and miscommunication. Has enhanced measurement of performance and accountability. - Has promoted design and systems thinking in the organisation and has facilitated discussion around work methodologies, team structures, and roles in a depth and detail that wasn't possible before. - Allows for framing of information through use of databases that makes it simpler too understand at a glance without the need of another person explaining it, which has made onboarding or replacement very easy

content: Highly flexible, with its effectiveness varying greatly depending on how it is used. Likes: We utilize this tool for task management in internal projects. Since management items can be freely configured for each space, it’s highly convenient for adapting to the specific needs of each project or individual management level. Additionally, integrating it with Google Calendar allows the home screen to display a combination of scheduled events and tasks, making it very easy to check what needs to be done today. We also link meeting notes transcribed using another tool into Notion and leverage its AI features. For example, by asking questions like, "What opinions were raised about xxxx?", we can quickly extract the information we need, which is incredibly valuable. With so many features available, I feel there’s still much to learn in mastering its full potential. However, it’s clear that this is a versatile tool with great potential for expanding its use depending on your ideas. Dislikes: For instance, having a feature that allows tasks from another space to be referenced and synchronized with private tasks would be incredibly helpful. This would enable individuals to manage their personal tasks while also reflecting updates in shared project tasks seamlessly. In terms of UI, while the tool is highly functional and user-friendly, the overall screen design feels somewhat faint, making it challenging to create visual distinctions. As the number of pages and tasks increases, it becomes harder to navigate. I believe it would be much more intuitive if conditions or settings could allow for color changes or emphasis, making it easier to visually organize and distinguish elements. Problems Solved: Sharing tasks within the team has become much easier. Since we are handling multiple projects simultaneously and across various areas, organizing and sharing tasks effectively has been a challenge. While we are still exploring the best ways to utilize the tool, we are optimistic that improvements can be made.

content: After switching between various tools to centrally manage my work, Notion has now my go to tool Likes: With something like Notion, I dont have to switch between various tools for search for knowledge and research materials at different places. I keep all my ideas, thoughts, plans, product details, research material etc. at one location with it. I have tried so many tools to manage my knowledge but then it becomes too messy for me to manage. I have moved from randomly created Excels for my research, Onenote, Airtable, Obsidian and so many other platforms but since nobody solves my problem completely, I come back to Notion. We use office 365 suite which has a competing product - Microsoft loop - which i also tried my hands on. But it is so buggy amd limiting that I detest it and it becomes a drag in front of robustness and smoothness of Notion. Also, while there are obvious areas where Notion does not help in building my knowledge base, but it has countered it very well by giving integrations with those tools that I use (like Miro, Whimsical etc.) which are embedded as part of the page. Dislikes: While I currently manage with Notion database tables for my lists and research material, I sometimes feel that items related to Database related tasks, i.e. keeping and managing a list, Airtable seems more workable. It has larger and fixed area to work on, and scrolling left to right or top to bottom is seamless. It seems more handy for longer lists but I do hope Notion can will improve the experience in that aspect. Problems Solved: At a high level, I have juggle between too many things at my workplace and personally too. I need a central area to manage things without getting lost into things. Plus, there are many smaller features which are great. As an example, the variety of kinds of blocks it gives me to handle different types of conent. The page can be designed anyway which helps me browse things easily. Similary, pages and toggle lists keep my long research collapsed in groups for easy viewing, that I can expand when needed. So, I would say it helps me keep my things organized and view them those items in a dashboard format, which I can expand if required.

content: Notion is one of my favorite tools for project planning and collaboration Likes: Notion is very intuitive to use. It is my preferred tool for planning and collaborating on projects, especially to define timelines and organize useful resources and information in databases. I also think it works very well as a company-wide internal documentation tool. I have used it almost everyday in the past couple years. Dislikes: The Search experience across pages is not so good. It has improved in the past few months, but could be better. Databases could be more seamlessly integrated with Google Sheets as well. Problems Solved: Notion allows me to store information in databases with an organized view and an increased user experience. It has more capacity to store in-depth pieces of information (like images, urls, tags, attachments...) for each item when compared to other tools. As a knowledge base, it works very well, providing a "landing page" for each internal team and project that enables me to compile and direct to multiple sources of information when necessary. This solves the problem of having documents stored across many different places and also the problem of visualization and ease of use of other tools.

content: Meets my requirements Likes: I love how super organized it is. I use it as a place to store my notes and other documentation. There's a lot of templates I can choose from to set up each page to work the way I want. Each page can be shared to anyone I want (can only view) or you can give someone access to your workspace so they can edit. When I copy and paste anything to my Notion, I don't have to worry about formatting etc. because it always does a default font and size for everything (which saves me a lot of time at work). One unique thing I use is the 1:1 template to track what I do day-to-day, making it easier to remember what on what day. I use it daily –without it, I won't be as organized with all my things and be successful. Dislikes: One downside is that when I leave a page, if I go back to the page, it always makes me go back to the top instead of where I last left off. This only impacts the pages where it's lengthy and detailed, but if you have short notes, then it's not really an issue. Other than that, no cons that I know of. Problems Solved: Organization for sure. One issue is that there is lack of documentation or documents were everywhere and not in one place as a source of truth. I utilize Notion to solve this issue by organizing information in one place. Keeping track of notes from meetings is easier to track in Notion compared to other platforms. The AI tool is useful sometimes to use when I am looking for ideas.

content: One Stop Shop for Productivity and Organizing - From Travel Plans to Business Processes Likes: For me, Notion is everything that MS Office lacks. It has integrated AI and serves as a one-stop shop for note-taking, travel planning, social media calendars, etc. I have set up my entire business processes through Notion. What especially stands out to me is the page system. I am also very fond of the keyboard shortcuts (for bullets, headings, and color), which I learned specifically to increase my efficiency. Overall, I have integrated Notion into my daily scheduling and note-taking, and I am very happy with it. Dislikes: I have two minor dislikes about Notion - 1. Exporting - Exporting should have more options. Even for PDFs, there should be options to edit how you want the PDF to look. Sometimes the PDF ends up not being formated as per the Notion page. It would be helpful to have editing options before exporting. 2. Table Cells - There is immense potential for notion to create better table cells. They should be easy to use, and have more intuitve formulas. There should be options to add formulas to individual cells. Problems Solved: As I mentioned - for me notion is a one-stop shop for note-taking, travel planning, social media calendars, business plans, etc. It is solving the problem of unproductivity for me through the following way - It is very convenient to have all features like embedded maps and websites, pages, tables, databases calendars etc in one application. It greatly increases productivity.

content: I became a self-appointed Notion-ambassador in our organisation Likes: Oh man, Notion is seriously a game-changer! Since I was instroduced to it by my ex-colleague, I’ve been using it for everything, from work projects to personal to-do lists, and it’s just so flexible and easy to use. You can literally customize it any way you want, which is perfect for organizing my chaotic brain (my neurodivergent colleagues swear by it too) . Plus it’s all in one place. No more jumping between apps for notes, tasks, and databases. And on top of that it integrates into other apps like Slack and Glean, which makes searching for documentation feel like real life magic. I also love how you can collaborate with your team in real-time. It makes working on projects together so smooth. Plus, all the templates available are a huge time-saver. I had to create separate meetings for multiple teams in my org to tell them how to use the basics of Notion so they can drop their outdated excel sheets and move over to the great side. In all fairness, they still are yet to discover full functionality of Notion, but they seem sold already. If you haven’t tried Notion yet, you’re seriously missing out. Dislikes: I got nothing to complain about, but based on feedback from my colleagues: Notion can be a bit overwhelming for first-time users, especially if they’ve never used a knowledge base before. With so many features and templates, it’s easy to get sidetracked. It would be great if there was a setup wizard with multiple questions to help pre-build a space based on your needs, using some helpful text prompts to guide you along the way. Problems Solved: Notion helps us by being a single knowledge base where we store all our docs and processes. It's super helpful that we can integrate Google Drive files, so people who prefer using those can keep everything organized. Personally, I use Notion for my to-do lists, which I can share with colleagues when I'm out of the office or swamped with other projects. Our team also uses it for tracking side projects and assigning tasks.

content: Good for organization and writing Likes: I like having documents organized and embedded in one another for copywriting and site mapping. I also love writing up documents and reports and sharing them as a live view link; it can look super professional, and it's easy to use. The task database is really flexible for your needs and customizable. Dislikes: Though Notion is great for getting organized, it's easy to waste a lot of time "optimizing." Sometimes, a sticky note is just faster, and it's easy to over-customize and build things you don't actually need. It's smart and capable, which is great, but it's easy to build the "task manager to end all task managers" and make something too complicated that you don't actually need. The templates are the same story. Secondly, the AI isn't as intelligent as I would like it to be. It doesn't see the whole picture of all the documents in the workspace, but only works with whatever is on the page you're currently on. It doesn't make databases or pages, which I find limits it to a semi-handy writing assistant. As a writer, I don't think the writing is good enough to be that useful. The AI is a nice thought, being embedded in the program, but it's a little disappointing, honestly. Problems Solved: It's great for recording all my tasks, ideating for social media content, project management, and note-taking.

content: Notion is a flexible, powerful tool (and AI makes it more so) Likes: Notion is incredible at giving you the flexibility you need to create whatever you need—from a simple notes library to reminders to project management. Over my two years of using it I've developed systems that help me in my day-to-day tasks both as a business owner, creative freelancer, and even a father of 4 kids. All of my notes and projects live inside Notion and I use it daily. Dislikes: While a selling point of Notion is its powerful tools, the complexitiy is also a downside. It took me several tries to understand it, and I gave up just as many times until it finally clicked. Notion does a decent job of helping you learn, but it's almost like trying to teach someone Adobe Photoshop. There are so many tools that you kind of need to dive in and explore in order to learn them all. That itself is a barrier of entry for the person who isn't technically inclined. Problems Solved: I manage anywhere from 3-5 projects at a time, all with their own assets, tasks, and deadline. Notion is flexible enough that I'm able to build a project management software tuned to my specific needs and desires. It also is a ready repository for all my notes, spanning from family to books I read to work notes. With all of my notes and projects living inside of Notion, the AI features are able to search my own personal notes. Just this morning I asked the AI assistant, "in what note did I write about looking for clients with a 500k budget?" It was able to search the my whole database and link to my precise note. Having AI plugged directly into the knowledge database I'm building is awesome.

content: Superpowering your copywriting Likes: I am always aware of the power of Notion, the blank canvas that can evolved into any kind of document your require. As someone that isn't the most disciplined planner, I may not take advantage of all the feature on offer from Notion, but the AI assist has been a huge ally in my day to day work. Notions 'Ask AI' has become a standard part of the daily workflow, often drafting then having the AI recommend improvements to the copy before I send, especially when communicating with customers or the Senior Leadership team. When compared to the output of other tools like ChatGPT, the recommendations are often subtle, more mindful of the tone of voice, less abstract that what other tools offer. The investment in Notions AI add-on is a no brainer, and the ROI is much higher than the outlay. Would recommend Dislikes: There's not a lot to dislike here. Using it to make copy longer, shorter, simple grammar checks or wholesale rewrites or tonal changes. content: Incredibly adaptable shared workspace with a very steep learning curve Likes: Notion is a very friendly, sleek, wonderful looking shared workspace. Pages look great by default with very little extra work, but can also be modified heavily with advanced methods. Their website also has a lot of free and paid templates to show just how different pages can look and how many different things it can do. The ability to nest data heavily into itself is also a great feature, and makes workspaces very easy to organize. The ability to have shared workspaces and private workspaces separate on the same document is also great. Dislikes: Notion's learning curve is very steep. The UI is very friendly on the surface, and easy to get the hang of, but after getting further into it you realize how incredibly dependent Notion is on tables/databases. Which is fantastic in theory, but they haven't made the process of adding or updating tables very user friendly. Once you get the hang of it it's wonderful and easy to apply to so many problems, but it took me days of pouring over tutorials to really understand Notion as well as I wanted to. I haven't had to do that with many other programs. I would heavily consider the computer literacy of your team before adding Notion to your workspace, and possibly consider using only experienced Notion users to manage your data on it. I'm also not sure why they decided to make Notion Calendar an entirely separate program, but it does affect my workflow. I would expect calendars to be something I could nest inside an existing page very easily. Which you can, technically, using tables. But it's not as easily integrated as I would have hoped. Problems Solved: Notion is fantastic for organizing things we need to keep track of, and putting them in a space that everyone can see and access easily.

content: Super useful tool to organise knowledge and get everyone on the same page. Likes: Notion is easier to use for more people than more enterprise-focused knowledge management systems. We use it for our church's staff knowledge and can see using this across our volunteering teams as well. If you plan to use notion as a customer support knowledge base, probably go for another tool because the AI-assisted search is a paid member feature. (It would have been much better to have this built-in for free for all users.) AI upgrade NFP pricing: It would have been good to have the discount % given to NFP's for the normal membership extended to this Notion AI as well. Project management tools are lacking: This is in development but has a while to go before easily practical. Database automation are lacking: Eg you can't be specific on an automation trigger. Most fields are limited to a single property trigger of 'edited'. This is very limited. Versatile ITTT statements would be much appreciated. content: Notion is like having an external hard drive for your brain Likes: I find that when I have big ideas for my business, Notion is the place I come to organize myself and develop those ideas into something more concrete. I love that I can create sub-pages, toggled content, to-do lists, and mood boards in one spot. The primary ways I use it are: 1) To organize client projects. I have a reusable template that I can easily customize for each project and share it with my clients. I LOVE how easy it is to share with clients. 2) To organize all the moving parts of my business such as a task calendar, content for blog posts, partnerships I have with brands, collaborations with other businesses, my SEO strategy, code back-ups, and a place to store brand assets, etc. 3) To help generate ideas for content! I am loving the AI writing assistant. I love to write and blogging is my primary marketing strategy. I use the writing assistant to help me generate ideas for posts and create outlines that I can then add my own ideas to. It is also AMAZING for tedious stuff like writing meta descriptions for Pinterest pins or web pages. I love that there is very little friction to get started with it. You can use it for very basic stuff like I do or you can develop more complex systems if you really want to dive in. Dislikes: As a designer, I would love some more ability to customize the appearance of the stuff that I share with my clients. There are some customizations but they are minimal. It would also be great if they had more features for client-facing stuff such as forms (kind of like what Tally does-though you can integrate Notion and Tally, which I do!). Problems Solved: I am a solopreneur and my business has multiple arms. Client-facing, e-commerce, and partnerships And also do all organic marketing. So if I didn't have a place that I could put all of this, that was easy to use and customize, I would have a harder time running my business. I think the fact that it is so easy to dash something off in Notion, and find it again when I need it allows me to harness creative ideas that I might otherwise lose. As far as writing content, using the AI writing assistant has been a game-changer! I have been able to post more consistently on my blog which has led to better SEO, more traffic, and more income. It's easy to access it anywhere in Notion, on any page which is great. I have found the quality of the ideas that the AI provides to be really useful. And if it gives me something that's not quite what I'm looking for, it's easy to refine the result by adding more or different information to my request.

content: The Swiss Army Knife for Nearly All of Life Likes: At first the sparseness of the application can scare you, but it is this "build it how you want" capability that allows users to create and implement any number of uses for the application both professionally and on a personal level. Add to this the fact that the software can be nearly everywhere; phone, table, computer, or cloud and combine this near universality with its API integrational capabilities and you have the makings of a workhorse that most will find they use nearly every day if not every hour and minute to accomplish so very much. There's a lot more that could be said, from the potential use of Notion AI to the stellar community of support on multiple platforms. All-in-all a very powerful and versatile tool to say the least. Dislikes: About the only knock that I could give the company and not necsarily the application is a lack of a hard and fast roadmap. I get it, the process can be daunting and the flexibility of not having a published roadmap has its pros, but with a software so young and still ever evolving, knowing what might come next would be nice for the user base, enabling them to plan ahead. Problems Solved: Having everything tied together in a single, sourcable environment is the biggest benefit in mind. Managing projects linked with notes that are often curated by AI all compiling into a knowledge base is pretty stellar both in the present and, as recall is needed, in the future.

content: Notion AI review - Analyst experience Likes: Above all, Notion has an incredibly user-friendly interface which makes its advantageous to use for everyday work. I find the platform so intuitive and I'm surprised more people at work aren't using it. The AI element is also far more advanced than I thought it would be, and a strong competitor for OpenAI's GPT. Dislikes: There is some poor marketing surrounding Notion, unfortunately. I find that a lot of people are still confused about the use-case of Notion. Is it a data repository, a PM tool, a writing platform, a task manager, etc? This makes it difficult to achieve buy-in from other members, which ultimately undermines the "teamwork" aspect of Notion, not many team members use it. Problems Solved: Notion AI is incredibly helpful, it can distill key messages from meeting notes, thus saving time. It also allows for clear and organized task management, which is a big help for me in my day-to-day role. Note-taking is also extremely easy to do, I've completely swapped over from Microsoft Word to Notion, given how easy the user interface is. The only issue is the cap on the AI use.

content: My experience with notion Likes: What I like best about Notion is its flexibility and adaptability. Its cross-platform compatibility ensures I can access my information from any device, and its collaborative features make teamwork seamless. Some users have also reported occasional performance issues, particularly with larger databases or the web application. Additionally, the pricing structure, with more advanced features behind a paywall, may not be suitable for all users. Despite these drawbacks, Notion remains a versatile productivity tool with a devoted user base. This consolidation streamlines my workflow and saves time by eliminating the need to switch between multiple apps or platforms. Furthermore, Notion's customizable features allow me to tailor the platform to suit my specific needs, whether I'm managing personal tasks or collaborating on team projects. This adaptability enhances my productivity by providing a cohesive workspace where I can easily access and organize information. Overall, Notion's ability to centralize information and adapt to various use cases benefits me by simplifying my workflow, improving organization, and ultimately boosting productivity.

content: Notion is great for every aspect of my life! Likes: I love the calendar feature because it lets me organize my weeks, create checklists, and syncs up to my Google calendar on my phone. The versatility of the different features and their ease of use lets me customize each page to whatever I need. Large card-views help me to make different class agendas for the subjects I assist in teaching, toggle menus help to create flash cards that are easy to rearrange by dragging and dropping, and the outline options with bullets, colors, and highlights is amazing for taking notes and streamlining them later. The AI is also a feature I use every day. Whenever I need a summary of a text for a quick review or clarification of subject matter, it is a reliable assistant and teacher to help me learn independently! Dislikes: I don't think there is anything that I particularly dislike about Notion. I originally felt slightly put off that the calendar feature added yet another tool for me to juggle, but now that it syncs with my Google calendar, I have everything I need no matter what device or platform I am on. Problems Solved: Notion lets me be organized in a way I have never experienced before. I can easily drag and drop tasks to different days on my calendar, rearrange my notes after taking them, and make flash cards to review from the toggle feature. Both my college education and my job as an assistant in a Special Needs high school class have benefitted greatly from the organization features. The AI has also helped me to create simpler explanations, make unique passages that can apply to each of my students interests, and help me to study and understand materials.

content: Our business uses Notion for almost everything Likes: Notion has achieved a software ideal: being flexible/ambiguous enough to have a wide range of uses yet also powerful enough in each individual use case to be a viable alternative to more dedicated tools. As a designer I mostly love Notion's carefully considered design—not merely in how UI elements are styled but in the overall product design and the philosophy behind it. It's easy to use and it just works. Dislikes: The main downside for me is that because Notion allows you to build your own tools with so much flexibility, I often spend more time than necessary building out a tool or workflow with complex formulas and functionality, only to find that I don't end up using it. This is not so much a downside of Notion, but an area where some users like me might need better discipline. Customer support has been helpful and responsive via email, though it would be even better if Notion offered live chat support. Problems Solved: It allows us to have well-organized and searchable documentation, living in the same place as our tasks and backlog, feature requests, meeting notes, and all the rest. Having all this in one place, and now being able to edit with AI without leaving the app, is saving us lots of time and increasing the quality of our work.

content: Simple, efficient note taking application with many features Likes: The best thing I like about Notion is that it is very user friendly at first. It is easy to set up Notion and quickly get to creating notes. It is much convenient to create points which we might need to remember for later on and alongside this, it is also very convenient to create entire subject notes and create a personal documentation for further reference as well. The color coding feature is also a very useful feature with the help of which I can color different points in different colors and can personally assign any importance to it. Also, the less amount of fonts is actually a pro for me because I don't need to think much about font and font size and try to overcustomize the notes and can straightaway get to making notes itself. The different templates present in the notion, the database feature, views, basic templating make in itself enough features to provide a note taking application with the help of which I can create personal documentation for myself as well as a knowledge base for the organization. Dislikes: One thing, I dislike about notion is that I cannot create offline notes nor I can store the notes in my own system in the form of markdown files or any other format. It is very difficult to export large amount of notes from Notion to the system, in the free version provided by them. Apart from it, when trying to access the databases feature or formulas feature, there is a slight learning curve which I feel could have been made easier with the help of proper resources or an in app guide with hands on learning tutorial so that it can be used by everyone. Problems Solved: I mostly use Notion to create Knowlege base or to create personal notes. In the personal notes, I use it to note down important points which I might need to refer later on, or I use it to note down any patterns or findings which I find while writing code and think that it could benefit me in future. Also, the color coding feature and the views feature of notion helps to organize notes and clear the importance of the sentences in a visual manner which makes reading and in turn learning a lot more enjoyable and interactive experience. The fact that the notes can also be hosted in the form of a website and thus be shared with anyone as well as remotely synced makes it a lot more beneficial for me to continue using Notion for my note taking needs.

content: The best thing since sliced bread. Literally. Likes: I began using Notion at the start of 2023 as a way to help me consolidate my brain and advance my business. Now with notion AI I am able to take my ideas and have them come to life in a way that would never have been possible myself. I just bring the ideas, notion brings them to life, then I action them. It's a flawless system that is only as good as the questions you ask it. Dislikes: I would like to see a bit more ChatGPT style integration. I do find it limiting sometimes that the AI only uses itself to learn, in some regard it is good because you teach it what it needs to know, but it would be good to have some wider knowledge too. Problems Solved: It just helps me fly through process of explaining things and fleshing out ideas, so I can focus on coming up with ideas then making them happen.

content: Easy to use, lots of options Likes: I love how highly customizable Notion is. I also love how I can invite people on my team to be guests and participate with the material I'm creating. Dislikes: It can be overwhelming on how to set up pages/databases as you want it because there are so many options and you have to learn the tools to be able to use this very powerful tool. So there is a big learning curve. Problems Solved: One of the biggest ways notion is helping us is that I produce a weekly podcast. There are many tasks we need to complete before the podcast goes live and even after the podcast goes live. With my team I can organize all these pieces so that we can stay on top of this weekly production. So Notion functions like a to do list, a way to communicate with my team about each of the steps, a way to write show notes, and social media content for the podcast, and a way to track the schedule as it changes. I'm probably forgetting some things, lol

content: One tool that smoothed out my life's rough edges Likes: I kept seeing Notion being mentioned here and there for a few years and finally had what it takes to take up a new software a few years ago. Even though it took me 2 tries to fully integrate Notion into my life, I finally have THE dashboard I can go to for anything in my life - if I need to make a to-do list, a reminder, keep notes about my hobbies or use a template to evaluate the prioties in my wishlists, and now even draft my work emails (thanks to the new AI feature). Speaking of AI, while I'm usually a big sceptic, the intergation has been seemless for me and I've enjoyed it specifically for getting suggestions on how I can paraphrase or shorten my messages before I send them off. I also appreciate Notion staying an approachable and FREE software beyond words - it makes it so easy to reccommend to friends and family. Problems Solved: I love having Notion as the one-stop-shop for my home life, hobbies, work, or even journaling my thoughts. content: Notion for Grad School Likes: Notion has become my go-to location to track all my work for graduate school. Over the last few years I have built a hub for ALL my work, building integrations with apps like Zotero and Flow that have improved my efficiency at work. The initial learning curve is a bit challenging to overcome but so easy to use. I like that I can do all my work through a central hub without having to download multiple apps (which I did before). Is notion the best at every feature? No. But it makes it super easy! Also the apps that do ONE thing well also require learning and it gets exhausting after a point. As a PhD student, this has become the best decision I made regarding organizing my life. Dislikes: The Calendar feature is not the best. Would love it if I could use my outlook work calendar in here - as of now i maintain 2 separate calendars (which is fine). I really love how you can make detailed pages in the calendar - but if only it could let me use Outlook! Problems Solved: My biggest problem being a grad student and lab manager is that I needed a space where I could take notes, manage my research, and also maanage multiple projects in my lab. The initial phase of my use (the first 6 months) everything was in separate pages, but now I have a central hub - where i manage EVERYTHING, including grant applications. Super easy. Also - I have built in so many integrations - my favourite is the Zotero - where I can input papers and it automatically builds a reference manager.

content: Value of Notion AI in summarizing content Likes: I value Notion as a way of storing content I want to leverage at a later date. These summaries help capture the essence of the original content. I also like the various ways content can be captured. Among my favorite options are embedded documents and videos. Dislikes: Sometimes, when doing a search, the item I expected to be included does not show up. This might be impacted by how I frame the search terms. content: To-Do Lists and Brainstorming Hub Likes: I like the status buttons and that they are color-coded so it pops out more. I like that this platform feels like one long-running but organized to do list. You can have one central project and create different headers, bulleted lists, check-lists and status updates all under one roof. This is like everything I scribble down on a notepad but in a very streamlined and organized way. Dislikes: Some of the templates could be a little more in-depth and have some more descriptions and niche uses. Problems Solved: Notion is helping individuals and teams solve project management issues. Especially in Marketing or other creative industries there are so many steps involved in each aspect, task, and sub-task of a project. It is easy to lose parts in the process. With this system you can create projects for yourself to stay on top of your own projects and deadlines, and you can also assign projects to others so everyone has access to the same document/project. This is a way to hold both yourself and your teammates accountable.

content: Useful organizational tool for a productive undergraduate student. Likes: I can state many benefits of Notion, as it greatly assists a busy undergrad student like me. I use the Notion Desktop application and the Notion Calendar. I have used this application for a year now and I wish I could've started using it sooner. I enjoy the templates that I can use to organize my classes, as well as be able to export my notes to other classmates so they are kept up to date. It lets me implement my information with ease and no difficulty. I enjoy the real-time updates so that I am able to access my information on my phone. I also pay a monthly membership to use the AI features, which are beneficial towards me. I am able to summarize my class notes without difficulty, as well as create outlines for myself so that I can better organize my notes and look up definitions for terms that I do not understand. Overall, I use Notion every day and it has been very helpful towards me. Dislikes: The downside of using Notion is not being able to use it in "offline mode" unless I load the page first. This is concerning for a student like me, because I need to have access to this info at all times. If I do run into an internet connectivity issue, I have no problem switching to my phone's hotspot so I can load the pages. In general, this is a small disadvantage and I understand why there is no offline mode implemented. I also hope that there can be more fonts included in the future. Problems Solved: I am trying to solve my problem with keeping my notes organized, as well as summarizing my notes so that I can pull the important information out and not stress myself out with irrrelevant information. This benefits me as a student, so I do not have to excessively read and get access to the notes summary that matters.

content: My go-to software for organizing my freelance and personal projects Likes: Notion is a software that can be just about anything you need it to be. It gives you the canvas and tools to build whatever pages, databases, wikis, or boards you need to organize your life or business. And if you're not a do-it-yourselfer, there are hundreds of pre-built templates from fellow Notion users. If you're looking for a dedicated CRM, project management, or goal tracker tool, you'll find other dedicated products with more robust features, but if you want to consolidate all of these services and more into a single, affordable, software, you won't find anything better than Notion. I use Notion every single day for everything from household finances and home projects to client and project tracking for my freelance business. Dislikes: Notion's feature set currently lacks in a few areas: (although each of these are listed as upcoming features by the Notion team) - Workflow automation options are limited, with only a few triggers/actions to choose from. The public API is nice, and there are a lot of out-of-the-box integrations offered, but Webhooks and more automation options would go a long way. - Database permissions are limited in that it's impossible to grant different users/groups permissions to different subsets of the data in a database. This is especially frustrating if you want a common database driving task/project management across your entire organization but don't want all tasks visible to everyone. - Database templates that are built or updated after some of the database is populated can not be automatically applied to all existing database entries. This makes for a tedious process if you want all entrys in the database to have a common look/feel. Problems Solved: I use Notion to manage my novel writing, household finances, home projects, freelance business, and as a host for my webpage. I've never encounted software with this level of flexibility before.

content: A new all in-in-one workspace Likes: Notion, an all-in-one workspace, redefines productivity and collaboration by offering a versatile platform that seamlessly integrates note-taking, task management, database organization, and team collaboration. It's a robust, customizable tool that adapts to various workflows and individual preferences. Notion's database features empower users to create powerful organizational tools. From simple lists to complex databases, users can design dynamic systems that adapt to evolving needs. The relational database capabilities allow for interlinking information across different pages, enabling comprehensive data organization and retrieval. Dislikes: Despite its strengths, there are areas where Notion might fall short. For instance, while flexibility is a boon, it might also lead to a slightly steeper learning curve for new users. Understanding the full potential of Notion and customizing it to individual needs might take some time and exploration. Furthermore, the extensive customization options might sometimes lead to complexity. Users might find themselves spending time configuring the workspace instead of focusing on tasks, especially if they prefer a more straightforward approach to organization. Problems Solved: Notion helps us to save the knowledge base for processes, billing reports, and updates. We no longer have to use a different tool for reports and we don't have to send emails just to send an update. We'll just need to go to Notion and create it and tag everyone.

content: I run my entire life on Notion Likes: The standout feature of Notion is its incredible versatility. It's a chameleon in the world of productivity apps, transforming from a simple note-taking platform to a comprehensive project management tool. There's no area of my life that doesn't have a Notion aspect to it right now. From work project management to travel planning, note taking or cooking, there's a template or a Notion page for everything. The UI is clean and intuitive, and makes navigating through different functionalities a breeze. Templates offer a starting point for almost any project you can imagine. Furthermore, the collaborative features in Notion are a game-changer. Being able to share pages and work simultaneously with colleagues or friends enhances productivity and brings a seamless experience to project coordination. Dislikes: One of the main issues I've encountered is the learning curve, particularly the new formula language. It might take some time to fully grasp how to utilise all of Notion's functionality effectively. Additionally, while its mobile app provides the convenience of accessing your workspace on the go, it sometimes lacks the fluidity and responsiveness of its desktop counterpart. Performance can be sluggish, particularly when handling larger pages or complex databases. Lastly, I find the offline functionality limited, which can be a significant drawback for those who often work without a stable internet connection. Problems Solved: One of the primary problems Notion solves for me is information fragmentation. In a world where data is scattered across various apps and platforms, Notion serves as a centralized hub for all my needs – be it note-taking, project management, or content creation. This consolidation drastically reduces the time and effort spent in switching between different tools, thereby enhancing overall efficiency. The AI functionality in Notion is a game-changer, especially in terms of content creation and organisation. It assists in generating ideas, creating outlines, and even suggesting refinements to written content. This AI assistance is not just about saving time, it's about enhancing the quality of the output. For someone who regularly engages in content creation, this feature has been invaluable.

content: Notion AI review Likes: Versatile and Customizable Workspace - NotionAI offers a highly customizable workspace that adapts to the unique needs of users. Its modular structure allows for the creation of databases, notes, to-do lists, calendars, and more, making it suitable for various purposes, from project management to personal note-taking. Intelligent Content Suggestions - One of NotionAI's standout features is its AI-powered content suggestions. It analyzes your notes and suggests related content, helping you discover connections and ideas you might have missed otherwise. This feature significantly enhances creativity and productivity. Collaboration and Sharing - NotionAI excels in facilitating collaboration among teams. It allows real-time co-editing, commenting, and task assignment, making it an ideal tool for remote and distributed teams. The ability to share specific pages or databases with external collaborators is a significant advantage. Cross-Platform Accessibility - NotionAI is available on various platforms, including web, desktop, and mobile applications. This ensures that users can access and update their information seamlessly, regardless of the device they're using. Robust Integration Ecosystem - NotionAI supports numerous integrations with third-party apps and services, enhancing its functionality and extending its use cases. This flexibility makes it adaptable to various workflows and preferences. Dislikes: Learning Curve- While NotionAI's versatility is a strength, it can also be a drawback for new users. The learning curve can be steep, and some users may find it challenging to harness the full potential of the tool without comprehensive tutorials or guidance. Pricing - NotionAI offers a free plan with limited features, but the pricing for premium plans may be prohibitive for some users, particularly for small teams or individuals. A more flexible pricing structure or additional features in lower-tier plans could address this concern. Offline Functionality - NotionAI's dependence on an internet connection can be a limitation, especially for users who need to access their data offline. Improved offline functionality would be beneficial for users in such scenarios.Search and Organization - While NotionAI has search capabilities, some users have reported that it can be challenging to find specific information within a large workspace. Enhancements to the search functionality and organization features would be welcomed. Problems Solved: Improve Search and Organization - While NotionAI has search capabilities, it can be challenging to find specific information within a large workspace. Enhancements to the search functionality and organization features would be welcomed.

content: Great tool for structuring internal data repository Likes: What I appreciate most about Notion is its integration of AI functions which significantly enhance productivity and organization. The ability to use smart templates and databases to automate tasks is a game changer. Notion’s AI cleverly streamlines the process of managing information, from planning projects to tracking habits, all within an intuitive interface. The seamless synthesis of notes, tasks, and databases, powered by intelligent algorithms, makes it easier to connect ideas and get work done efficiently. Its AI capabilities help in transforming scattered thoughts into structured action plans, which is why I find it incredibly valuable. Dislikes: One aspect of Notion that can be challenging is its reliance on advanced features, such as AI, to perform basic functions. For instance, without the AI to assist, I find it quite cumbersome to manually create and manage tables or to organize content effectively. The platform has a steep learning curve, and the absence of intuitive AI-driven guidance makes it difficult for me to set up even fundamental structures like databases or to sort information logically. This dependency on AI for essential tasks can be a significant barrier to maximizing the potential of Notion for those not well-versed in its more complex functionalities. content: Notion is a Great Tool for Management Likes: Using Notion makes it easy to manage a digital product, my example here will be a blog, by giving a user the ability to create pages as if they were posts on a blog website. By allowing the ability to create "infinite" pages through Notion, it allows the root page to act as a Category. This is great for breaking down blog post ideas and pre-emptively visualising how to structure the site before publishing anything. Their UI is also very easy and satisfying to use. Buttons do what you would expect and nothing feels out of place or "janky". With this in mind, it would make contacting customer support a breeze, since I would know where to find it. Dislikes: The main downside to Notion is its AI tool. While it is a great help in brainstorming ideas and fixing punctuation or grammar, it falls a little short in writing good-quality content. Some responses I would receive feel generic and lack more sophisticated thought than I would expect to receive from my prompt. That being said, I appreciate the level of sophistication in the current AI model and that user input is a key factor in the result of a prompt, but more variation in the results would be nice. Problems Solved: I personally use Notion to assist with my blogging website. I generally struggle with writing a solid blog post in the supplied software of the site, and much prefer using Notion to help with this. Notion makes it such a breeze to create Headings, Paragraphs, Lists, add Images, etc. that I can't see myself using anything else. I also enjoy using their AI system to help with brainstorming new ideas.

Using Notion makes it easy to manage a digital product, my example here will be a blog, by giving a user the ability to create pages as if they were posts on a blog website.

By allowing the ability to create "infinite" pages through Notion, it allows the root page to act as a Category. This is great for breaking down blog post ideas and pre-emptively visualising how to structure the site before publishing anything.

Their UI is also very easy and satisfying to use. Buttons do what you would expect and nothing feels out of place or "janky". With this in mind, it would make contacting customer support a breeze, since I would know where to find it.
metadata.dislikes:
The main downside to Notion is its AI tool. While it is a great help in brainstorming ideas and fixing punctuation or grammar, it falls a little short in writing good-quality content. Some responses I would receive feel generic and lack more sophisticated thought than I would expect to receive from my prompt.

That being said, I appreciate the level of sophistication in the current AI model and that user input is a key factor in the result of a prompt, but more variation in the results would be nice.
metadata.problems_solved:

I also enjoy using their AI system to help with brainstorming new ideas.

content: The promising productivity software, with infinite possibilities Likes: What I like best about Notion is its flexibility and versatility. It's a tool that adapts to my needs rather than the other way around. I can use it for note-taking, project management, task tracking, and even as a knowledge base. The ability to create custom databases and templates makes it incredibly powerful and customizable. It's a one-stop solution for organizing my personal and professional life. Dislikes: What I dislike about Notion is that, at times, it can feel a bit overwhelming due to its extensive feature set. It has a steeper learning curve compared to simpler note-taking apps, and it can be challenging to set up intricate databases and templates. Additionally, while the free version offers a lot, the pricing for the premium plans can be relatively high for some users. Nonetheless, once you get the hang of it, the benefits often outweigh these initial drawbacks. Problems Solved: Notion is solving several problems for me, which is immensely beneficial. Firstly, it helps me consolidate my scattered information and tasks into a single, organized space. This reduces the clutter and chaos of using multiple apps or tools for note-taking, project management, and knowledge management. Secondly, Notion aids in collaboration and knowledge sharing within my team. It allows us to work on projects collectively, centralizing all relevant information and progress tracking. This streamlines communication and enhances productivity. Thirdly, it provides a flexible and adaptable framework for my personal and professional needs. I can create custom databases, templates, and workflows to suit my specific requirements, which is a tremendous advantage. Overall, Notion's ability to solve these problems has made my work and life more organized, efficient, and collaborative, ultimately leading to increased productivity and better results.
