content: Notion is amazing tool for day to day activities Likes: I recently had the opportunity to experience the integration of AI with Notion, and I must say, it has been a game-changer. The ability to leverage AI to organize content, check writing, and integrate seamlessly with websites and Google tools has greatly enhanced my productivity and efficiency. One of the standout features is the AI-powered content organization. It's incredible to see how AI algorithms can analyze and categorize large volumes of information, making it easier to find and access relevant content quickly. This has saved me countless hours of searching and scrolling, allowing me to focus more on the tasks at hand. The writing assistance provided by AI is another standout feature. Not only does it offer helpful grammar and spelling checks, but it also suggests improvements to sentence structure and overall clarity. This has significantly improved the quality of my writing and saved me from embarrassing mistakes. The seamless integration with websites and Google tools is also worth mentioning. Being able to have Notion seamlessly interact with other platforms and tools I use daily has streamlined my workflow and eliminated the need for manual data entry or switching between multiple applications. Everything is now in one place, making it much easier to stay organized and efficient. Lastly, the AI's creative capabilities have been a pleasant surprise. The ability to generate unique and inspiring content has sparked my creativity and allowed me to think outside the box. Whether it's coming up with new ideas or creating visually appealing designs, the AI integration in Notion has truly expanded my creative horizons. Overall, the integration of AI with Notion has transformed the way I work and has become an invaluable tool in my daily routine. Its ability to organize content, enhance my writing, seamlessly integrate with other tools, and unlock my creativity is simply remarkable. I highly recommend exploring the AI features in Notion to experience the benefits firsthand. Dislikes: While copying and pasting text can be a convenient way to transfer information, it can sometimes be cumbersome and time-consuming. It may require formatting adjustments and can result in errors or inconsistencies. Additionally, if the text being copied contains links or images, they may not be preserved in the paste. However, there are alternative methods to extract or share content from Notion documents, such as exporting to different file formats or using integrations with other tools. Problems Solved: Notion has proven to be a valuable asset in tackling organizational challenges in my business. This powerful tool, in conjunction with Google tools, has greatly enhanced my ability to take notes and create a comprehensive wiki knowledge base for both personal and business tasks. Moreover, Notion excels as a collaborative platform, particularly when it comes to brainstorming with others.

content: Notion AI writing assistant Likes: I am a Master's student and I have to write at least 3 papers a month. I found myself not stressing out about the writing part and focus more on comprehension and gaining actual insights to write about from my coursework experience. I feel that the effort for trivial parts of the assignment like sentence structure steals away time from and even slows down my learning process, and Notion AI is a huge help. I can convert my original shorthand notes to a write up that adheres to specified word limits. I've tried other AI writers out there- and Notion is one of the best for professional writing. Dislikes: The "make longer" AI command could be a little more intuitive with more varied sentence structure. Also the "simplify" command does not really change the tone of a sentence how you would want to. Other than that, it's a pretty powerful tool. Problems Solved: The way I take notes is very cluttered. I read a lot of materials and integrating the core concept of everything I read into a single and effective write up is a challenge. But Notion does a great job of conceptual blending.

content: AI makes all the difference in Notion Likes: Holy smokes...I've used Notion in the past on and off and am skeptical about apps that charge subscription fees for AI when I already subscribe to GPT Plus. The integration makes a huge difference in Notion.ai and the beta feature for Q&A is outstanding, a chatbot trained on your data? This is a gamechanger, not because it's the only app that can do it, but it's ease of use and seamless integration are amazing. I've been a longtime Roam Research believer, but they've fallen far behind and AI is an afterthought, whereas it's fully integrated with Notion. Dislikes: Notion does have some complexity compared to other note-taking apps and it's not the only one with AI. Mem and others are also good, but I think in terms of sheer versatility, Notion.ai is a gamechanger for me. Problems Solved: It's hard to give Notion a single job. Many people refer to it as the operating system for their life. It's certainly capable of that (with some configuration) and what Notion can be is largely limited by your imagination. I'm using it to track projects, act as a knowledge base and manage projects.

content: Great for quick, effective, cross team coordination Likes: I love that the design elements are standardised so you do not have to think about what the page looks like and it still looks great / easy to read. I also like the commenting feature which enables team members to leave their ideas on the document without changing the original doc. I also find the AI feature incredibly helpful for writing executive summaries based on the contents of the doc. I have also used it to convert data into tables etc which is also timesaving. Customer Support was also helpful when I lost some content. Dislikes: It can be difficult to rearrange document structure and can get confusing quite quickly if you are working on a project for a long time. This can be frustrating moving around the docs and easy to get lost. However, the search bar makes it bareable, but I would benefit from a view that gives you a map of the structure. Problems Solved: I write plans and brainstorm with my team for projects. I manage some of the project in Notion and use Linear as well to track progress. There is often too many things to do and Notion helps me breakdown the core ideas and structure them in a way that is easy to understand and refer back to in the future.

content: Loving Notion! Likes: I love that it is so adaptable, it is truly a sandbox and the possibilities are infinite. I love that it is a really simple and clean interface, with no designs forced on the user. This frees up so much brain space and allows me to be creative in my own way. I love that it is making me more organised every day. As I use it more and more I am getting to know it's capabilities and it is making my life so much easier. As an entreprenuer, I am using it to power my business relaunch and it's keeping me on track with what I need to do. I love that it is constantly growing with me! Dislikes: It can feel a little overwhelming to start with but I think that's kind of necessary as it is very is very quick to learn, and I think if features were hidden etc it would get frustrating. I think the throw yourself in there and get on with it approach works well! Sometimes the AI goes down, this can be frustrating. Problems Solved: Notion is truly becoming my second brain! It gives me somewhere to dump out all my thoughts, get them organised and allow me the brain space to think clearly and be creative as I need to be. It also really keeps me on track with where I am with everything. It is also a bit like having a personal assistant. It helps me get things done, and I often use it to tell me what to do when I'm not sure what I need to do! Having ADHD and being a entreprenuer (and mum) means that I am always working on a million and one projects, Notion is really helping me follow through and feel so much more organised, especially when I have that dreaded brain fog! I can't stress enough how much Notion is benefitting me, reducing my stress levels, helping me be successful in my business and making me feel so much calmer. I feel like it will be able to grow with me too. I have already started using it for my home stuff as well. I just love the endless possibililties! I have attempted to use several project management solutions in the past but they never stick, I always end up feeling restricted by them. Notion blows them all out of the water because you can make it exactly what you need it to be, no one telling you you must do it a certain way etc, and I've yet to encounter something that I wanted to do with it but couldn't. It genuinely feels like anything is possible! It is truly absolutely genius and I can't recommend it highly enough! Thanks Notion!

content: Work Management Assistant Likes: I really like the way we can organize and keep track of the current activities, professional and personal, in just one place where we can control what to push to the primary focus and what to put to a "later" or "archive" space area. All very intuitive and versatile. With the introduction of AI, it made it even more efficient to have notion as the primary space where I know I can count on viewing what I have to do on a daily basis, with the possibility to turn a vague brainstorm text into something coherent with just 1 click (improve writing), or to prepare any big text I'm sending to anyone with the "Fix spelling & grammar", which makes me very confident on sending anything to anyone. Sometimes I use the AI feature to brainstorm ideas or scenarios, to give me copy, or to split an activity into parts, as I ask the AI to, for example, be "a UX director" which then provides more detailed and in-depth points for me to take into account. Really love Notion and I intend to keep using it for a long time. Dislikes: Sometimes I wished that the AI would remember some of the work we did or ask for help, or even to act based on the previous prompt I made or the previous answer that was provided. I see myself sometimes using other AI platforms to have bigger brainstorming sessions, or much more detailed asks simply because I cannot develop an idea with AI on notion, there is no "history tracking" nor opportunity to "conversate" in order to reach the best solution. It would be cool to have it on a "chat format" that keeps track of the conversation, and on the requests and adjustments made throughout the whole process. If the AI on notion had these features I would definitely recommend the product 200% to everyone who works or studies. Problems Solved: Notion is helping me be more effective in my day-to-day work activities since it helps me stay on track with my tasks, but also supports the work I develop by doing minor and major adjustments.

content: Notion is the AI superpowered workspace you've been searching for. Likes: Notion provides the perfect amount of flexibility for any workspace. The new AI Writing Assistant is also the perfect way to do everything you need to (including writing or brainstorming with AI) within the notion. My favourite part about the notion is that you can easily make templates to help you scale whatever you're doing fast, and the design for pages is inherently sophisticated but also fun (with emojis, colour and cover photos). I use notion pretty much daily to plan for my business, do writing, manage life admin and finances, and keep notes for all my conversations and meetings. I especially love that I can pull it up on my phone anytime and quickly find whatever I want in minutes, even when I'm on the go! I love the notion template marketplace as well, you can always find a quick and easy way to create and make your processes faster! My new favourite tools have to be the built in AI which can do so many things for you, including tell you answers to content on a page!! So cool. Dislikes: There is very little I don't like about the notion, but sometimes the offline experiences can be questionable (but honestly, it's probably because I'm using the wrong settings). There can be a tiny learning curve when you're first using it, but once you get the hang of it, it's pretty easy to continue working in there forever. Problems Solved: - A clean workspace that had a clean and sophisticated design built into it - AI tooling built in and super easy to integrate into your routine with keyboard shortcuts. - An incredible free tier that you could use (almost) forever. - A super beautiful and customisable way to manage pretty much anything you're doing from the palm of your hand to your office. - it's lightweight and gives me just the right amount of tooling and information to build pages ready to be published in minutes better than you can in word/google docs(in docs you have to do hypercustom things to achieve the same result)! - incredible integrations with my favourite sites like Figma/Canva, so I can preview that work all in notion too!

content: Harnessing Creativity and Efficiency: Likes: Notion AI, an innovative addition to the Notion platform, stands out for its capacity to generate and edit various types of content, ranging from blog posts and social media updates to creative stories and press releases. This AI tool, integrated directly within Notion, offers a user-friendly interface, allowing users to easily access its features. What sets it apart is its ability to customize content according to different audience needs and content types, showcasing a commendable level of creativity, especially in crafting narratives and titles. Initially offered for free, Notion AI has a pricing model of $8-10 per user per month for unlimited use, positioning it as a cost-effective solution compared to other AI services. Although it integrates seamlessly with the existing Notion ecosystem, making it highly beneficial for current Notion users, its appeal may be limited for those not using Notion. Additionally, the lack of integration with other systems and the possibility that it might not significantly differ from other AI tools in certain aspects could be potential downsides. Nevertheless, for those engaged in the Notion environment and focusing on content creation, Notion AI emerges as a valuable tool, offering a range of customizable options for text output and content generation. Dislikes: Notion AI's functionality is constrained within the Notion environment, and it does not offer integrations with external systems or tools. Problems Solved: Notion is essentially my Daily task app. It keeps me update and on track for all of my projects.

content: Notion AI is a fantastic addition to an already really great tool. Likes: * Notion helps me organize my thoughts and accounts and present them in nice Wiki pages and databases so that I can refer to them later. * I can collaborate with other teams to update them asynchronously in a less ephemeral place. * Notion AI is amazing at taking my raw notes from customer calls and summarizing them, doing research for me when I ask it a question -- I can't believe how easy it was to implement Notion AI into my everyday workflow. I use it at least once a day, if not more. * Notion is an integral part of my workday. Wouldn't be able to do my work without it. Dislikes: Notion, for the most part, is an AMAZING tool. There are only a few things that I dislike about the product. -- easier time to implement two+ columns of work. -- adding a vertical line possibility into the block. -- formulas could be a little easier to implement -- no pagination on side-view database to immediately go to next entry. Problems Solved: It's a very fine documentation tool that makes account management effortless. It holds all my notes, bookmarks and other stuff in one place so I have something to refer to quickly when I have a meeting with another team member or manager.

content: A smart way to organize both personal and business projects Likes: What is most helpful about notion is it's well thought-out organizational features. Notion has many advanced features, but the learning curve to get started using them is relative low considering how complex the app is. Inclusion of AI capabilities enhances its usefulness further, making it even easier to organize your thoughts and accomplish tasks within the app. The ability to share pages on Notion is also very useful. For instance, I used Notion to build a travel page for our upcoming family vacation. In addition to the calendar schedule and map features, which worked well for planning, organizing and quickly updating our itinerary, I used AI to generate a list of things to do in the area based on certain situations and criteria. Then I was able to share this page with family who are attending the trip. Dislikes: While it's fairly easy to learn how Notion works, it isn't always intuitive and can be a little clunky. It is jam-packed with features and the ability to create around databases, but sometimes it gets in the way of ease and setting things up in a more customized way. Also, Notion's lack of a true search function can be inhibiting when you have a lot of data stored within the app, especially within databases. This has directly impacted how often I use Notion vs other organizational and productivity platforms where I can easily find what I'm looking for amongst various projects. Problems Solved: Notion is excellent for organizing multiple items within multiple business projects. For someone who has multiple projects in gear or in planning at anyone time, Notion keeps me from having to access multiple apps, platforms, databases, and spreadsheets to plan and organize business projects. Also the AI feature cuts down on content writing and idea generation, allowing me to focus on the details of managing various projects. I also use Notion to create a 2nd Brain setup, which furthers the app's usefulness.

content: Using Notion for work and personal use! Likes: I do like the user design and experience of using Notion! It looks very appealing to the eye - especially using the tables, creating lists, and organizing thoughts together. I feel like the flow of pages makes sense when getting your point across The easy way of how it is seamless with making bullet points (it automatically makes sure the bullet points are consistent without too much work on our end). It's easy to organize a page to how you want it. Dislikes: Understanding Notion does take time. It is a bit overwhelming if you use it for the first time or on an irregular basis. When I try to show Notion to new users, it definitely takes a bit of time to get used to knowing how to navigate + construct pages and tables -- it has people gravitate away from using it. Sometimes I wish the connecting of tables on different pages would be easier to use or integrate, but it may be me that I need to practice more on utilizing this. There are also some functions in the table I wish it could do, for example, more calculation abilities in the table would be amazing! Problems Solved: Notion is solving the hardships people deal with note-taking and they take note-taking to a more simplified level, which is why I enjoy using it. It helps me keep my thoughts and ideas organized -- I like the color coding of it and how easy it is to include emojis and visuals. It is easy to share links with colleagues and friends and create limitations to certain pages and tables that should be kept private vs. public. I benefit by organizing my notes, table trackers, and upcoming plans pages. For work, I benefit from utilizing knowledge-based information on certain topics I am researching or need more insight on. It's nice to have any pages connected to each other that have similar topics -- it helps with finding what I am looking for and learning more along the way.

content: Named mine 'Kelsey's Second Brain' and I couldn't think of a better way to describe how useful it is Likes: My favorite things about Notion are how it's available across all my devices and will open my most recent page when I switch devices. It's so modular that you can build whatever you may need, but also simple enough to not get in the way of your work. The ability to publish pages for public access (or add a number of restrictions) makes this tool so much more versitile than others like it. The AI component is helpful for summarizing notes or taking my chicken scratch notes from a meeting and turning them into a pretty good first draft. The command to open the AI is so easy and has become a go-to shortcut. Dislikes: I'm not sure I have many bad things to say about my experience with Notion. I guess, I wish I could program the AI to know more about me and what I'll typically be using it for. Problems Solved: It's very helpful for me to keep all my projects organized and my notes in a centralized, universally-searchable space. I can take notes wherever I am (on my phone) and edit them later (on my computer). The AI has been helpful to create drafts of emails or Slack announcments -- it's not perfect, but it sure beats starting from a blank page.

content: Notion and Notion AI Likes: What I like most about Notion is how flexible it is. Unlike other apps that kinda force you into using specific templates for a variety of things (like formatted project planning docs or task-oriented to-do lists), Notion gives you a lot of options to organize things your way. And so it's easy to use and customize for everything I need; work, life, and school all in one place. Moreover, the user interface is quite intuitive and easy to navigate. Thus, it's easy to leverage its full suite of features without feeling overwhelmed. I've used it a lot for a lot of things and so I've also adapted my routine to it. Dislikes: There's a number of UI features that could be improved, in my opinion. This includes - ability to organize opened tabs, ability to control default opening view (i.e., new tab or side peek), ability to change margins, and improved use of reminders (like the reminder being turned off if the to-do is done or the task is marked done). Problems Solved: My team primarily uses Notion for project and sprint planning. The AI is very useful in this in terms of making templates for project requirements that help guide the meeting and allow us to think of the items need to be discussed and questions that need to be answered. It also makes it easier to turn bullet point notes into proper and clean documentation. I would say that templating is the strength of the AI assistant. It could use some better scoping though, since sometimes it considers things in the document that I don't necessarily want it to consider when writing or summarizing a part of the document. It is also helpful in putting up a knowledge base. I usually dump all that I have learned in using a tool in bullet points, and the AI is quite helpful in making that understandable. Again, I would say it is not as accurate as I would want it to. It gets confused after I ask to change it a couple of times (like make it longer, make it shorter, etc.).

As a student, I often use it to organize everything school-related to the schedule and take notes during lectures. I love how it even comes with a student template that allows me to track my schedule and grades. Customer support seems relatively easy to reach. My first time using it, it was hard to understand and learn how to use it. But after getting over the initial stage, it is straightforward and valuable. I like that I can export my notes into various files, and vice versa for importing files into notion. Last of all, the amount of features it offers for free is truly amazing. The price for some of the premium stuff is pretty reasonable. I've been using it for a year and won't stop using it unless otherwise.
metadata.dislikes: 1) Not being able to change the font sizes on the documents. 2) Not fully able to import pdf and PowerPoint slides into the pages with the notes in them (instead, it's just imported as the file itself). 3) Not useful for Android tablets. You can write on Notion using iOS, but not Android. I'm taking a few math courses where writing and drawing with the S pen would be handy. That's why I have to use my Samsung notes for any actual note-taking involving writing with the S pen. 4) The app on Android is not as user-friendly. For some reason, it isn't very easy for me to scroll through the pages on the app. I have to place my finger in a particular spot for the scrolling to be in effect. 5) The tutorials are somewhat hard to understand and navigate. It took me a while to understand how to use Notion.
metadata.problems_solved: Notion AI has been beneficial for me in terms of improving my writing, brainstorming ideas for things to write or how to write them, explaining things when needed, etc. I've been able to keep track of all my course assignments because of its schedule. I love the grade calculator provided in their student template - since it allows me to monitor all my grades. I love how I can share the pages and workshops with others. I've been mainly using it for note-taking, scheduling, grade tracking, and using Notion AI for writing improvement.

content: AI Writing Assistant Likes: Notion is a product that I use on a daily basis as a task manager, a note-taking system, and a place to store ideas and thoughts. Since Notion AI was introduced, I have used it to sharpen my notes by using the "improve writing" feature, as well as using the summary block to create a brief blurb on my database to find notes quickly and easily. The AI writing assistant also helps me to develop ideas when I'm stuck on how to start something. Asking AI to write something, gives me a template to start and then develop those ideas further. Dislikes: Notion is great for helping to create something tailored to your use case, however, that can be challenging at the beginning, as some may not have the time nor creativity to know what exactly they want to create. It can also sometimes get you bogged down in creating a system to help you, rather than getting on with the work you need to do. However, I have seen Notion developing instructional videos, and there are plenty of resources on YouTube to help you get up and running. Problems Solved: Notion has become my go-to system for all of my daily work. The ability to integrate all of your major work together and be linked so seamlessly helps me to keep track of plans and project details easily.

content: Use for both work and personal tasks Likes: For work, what I like the most is that I can have all the information I need in one place, also the visibility it's a plus. It's very easy to organise and find things. I can also have separate pages and can share some of the pages with other users. Working in collaboration is great when you need specific tasks to be done or followed up, adding comments or adding reminders it's great to make sure you keep things on track. I have used the AI tool to improve writing or change the tone, and to help writting processes and policies. I find a bit expensive if you are already paying subscriptions so I hope it gets more affordable with time. For personal life, I use to organise information for personal development, like short course links, notes and to add anything relevant. I also use as a tool to organise my CV and writing down emails and cover letters. I have been using the AI tool for that and it's great. Dislikes: There is nothing that I dislike about Notion, overall it's a great tool that I've been using for the long time. It might be a bit tricky to get used for the first time but, after awhile you see the value and how makes things way more easier to get organised and done. It's nice when you are in the stage of automating bottoms or adding databases, etc. I still have a long way to go in the usage and knowledge of Notion but, I don't see a reason to stop using it. content: Everything you need to create your best/happiest life Likes: Notion is amazing, because it's a structured place to put all your thoughts, ideas, professional work, budgets, and so much more. Being able to visualize and organize your life with the assistance of the Notion app genuinely allows you to see your life from a widespread/comprehensive point of view. For business owners it's also amazing, because Notion is able to be integrated into so many other platforms. You can put everything you need to see into one place and have it all update in real time as you grow your business. A few examples of using Notion for business is tracking several spreadsheets of expenses that all update in real time, maintaining customer data, or tracking marketing engagement. content: Amazing Organizational Tool Likes: I like Notion for being a sleek document and workspace product for organizing immense amounts of information while still feeling quick, responsive, and easily searchable - relationally documenting pages together (with a great API) is very helpful to quickly navigate and the universal quick search function is a boon for productivity. The Notion AI feature is one of the most competent ways of using AI I have seen in any product. Because it is so well integrated into the current working document it generates surprisingly competent results very quickly - e.g. summaries with a prompt for a specific format or to keep writing using an outline of ideas - and in the times it does not do a good job, it's easy to revise or reprompt quickly too. The Notion AI chat feature is also interesting to use. I like how it cites pages within your team's workspace and is so responsive. It's great since I have documents with hundreds of thousands of words altogether that I sometimes need to search from. As a developer, the Notion API and integration with databases is incredible. The centralization of my information all in my workspace is amazing for productivity by using Notion's view tools and also great for rapidly iterating on my apps based on data in Notion. Because of the ease of integrating all my work into Notion, I use it almost every single day, including for personal use as well. When I have had issues, customer support was responsive and kind. Dislikes: Notion's mobile and iPad experience could be greatly improved. While they both are fast and great for reading documents on the go, they aren't perfect experiences for editing. I wish for example that multiple Notion windows could be opened on iPad at once and that the way the iPad cursor worked could be less jittery. Applying styles to text is also not a great experience compared to desktop Notion. Problems Solved: Notion is helping me organize information across my work and personal life which helps boost productivity during my working hours - since I can quickly reference and add information.

content: Great productivity tool Likes: The best point I can highlight about Notion is its multi-utility, as the tool serves everything from spreadsheets to use as a text production tool. Additionally, the great integration of these features within the platform itself is excellent in terms of facilitating the creation of a self-functional ecosystem. Dislikes: Lack of integration of the Notion ecosystem with other more effective means outside the platform. The few integrations that exist are often restricted and insufficient. Allowing a more pure integration via API, enabling user customization of the integration to be made, could be a great solution to the issue. Problems Solved: Providing a multipurpose platform. So, if I need to do a task that doesn't require a complex spreadsheet, for example, while I have to write a lengthy text, I can do everything in Notion without having to switch between various platforms for that. I centralize everything in Notion.

content: A great product for an all to one features that includes GPT Ai functionality Likes: Notion Ai is a feature that allows you to use artificial intelligence to enhance your Notion experience. You can use it to generate content, organize your pages, automate your workflows, and more. It's like having a personal assistant that lives inside your Notion workspace. Sounds amazing, right? Well, it is...and it isn't. Let me explain. First of all, let me tell you what I like about Notion Ai. It's definitely a game-changer for creating content. Whether you need to write a blog post, a newsletter, a presentation, or anything else, Notion Ai can help you out. You just need to give it some keywords or a prompt, and it will generate some text for you in seconds. You can then edit it as you wish, or ask it to rewrite it in a different style or tone. It's like having a professional writer on demand. Another thing I love about Notion Ai is how it can help me organize my pages. Notion is great for creating all kinds of pages, but sometimes it can get messy and hard to find what you need. Notion Ai can solve that problem by automatically creating a table of contents, adding tags and categories, and suggesting related pages. It can also create summaries and overviews of your pages, so you can get a quick glimpse of what they contain. Dislikes: But not everything is perfect with Notion Ai. There are some drawbacks and limitations that you should be aware of before you start using it. One of the biggest issues I have with Notion Ai is how it can sometimes mess up my workflows. Notion is known for its flexibility and customization options, but that also means that everyone has their own way of using it. Notion Ai doesn't always understand or respect that. It can sometimes overwrite or delete my formulas, templates, databases, or integrations. It can also trigger actions that I don't want or expect, such as sending emails, reminders, or notifications. Another problem I have with Notion Ai is how it can sometimes generate inaccurate or irrelevant content. Notion Ai is smart, but not always reliable. It can sometimes make factual errors, grammatical mistakes, or logical fallacies. It can also generate content that doesn't match my keywords, prompt, or purpose. For example, I once asked it to write a blog post about the best productivity apps for 2023, and it gave me a list of apps that were discontinued or outdated. So what's my verdict on Notion Ai? Well, I think it's a great feature that has a lot of potential, but also needs a lot of improvement. It can be very helpful and convenient for some tasks, but also very frustrating and risky for others. I would recommend using it with caution and moderation, and always double-checking its output before publishing or sharing it. When I have a large document and I am too lazy, I paste it into Notion and have the Ai summarize or write conclusions for me. I just dump the information in andn request take away points. content: Notion + AI = Rocket Speed Likes: Notion in general has been a huge value-add to the stealth startup I've been building, but with the power of AI, I am moving faster than ever. In the past I've used Google docs and sharing features to get information in front of people, but that simply does not offer the brand experience I'm trying to develop. Now, Notion is the home to my documentation, resources, and templates that I offer to those in our brand ecosystem, which makes it look significantly more professional. For a year, I have also been using ChatGPT and other tools wrapped in ML and gen AI models. They are good, but typically fall short of being viable solutions. Notion AI on the other hand uses the same technology but absorbs all of the information that I put into a document or resource, and can quickly support these use cases: • Summarize transcripts • Expand or improve writing • Develop outlines and expand creative briefs • Adjust the voice/tone of content • Help generate new ideas and squash writer's block Dislikes: Currently, I can't say there is anything that I don't like about Notion. It does exactly what I need it to, is priced well, and its product roadmap is delivering beyond expectations. Problems Solved: I primarily use Notion as my source of truth and to securely share information with external parties.

content: Act as a great productivity and journaling tool Likes: As a user of Notion, one of the things I love most about it is its incredible flexibility and customization options. Notion allows me to create my own unique workspace tailored to my specific needs and preferences. I can design personalized layouts, templates, and databases that perfectly suit my workflow. This level of customization empowers me to stay organized and work efficiently. Whether I'm managing projects, taking notes, or organizing information, Notion's versatility allows me to adapt the tool to my way of thinking and working. It's truly a game-changer for my productivity Dislikes: While I appreciate many aspects of Notion, I find a few areas somewhat disappointing. One of the things I dislike about Notion is its steep learning curve. It can be overwhelming for new users to understand all the features and functionalities, hindering the onboarding process. content: My experience of personal and work use Likes: I preferred Notion over any other application because of its interface, which is very easy to navigate. I love how you can organize documents and the variety of available visualizations that are very useful. Additionally, if you have trouble structuring information, there are many helpful templates. I initially started using this software solely for personal use, such as taking daily notes, saving relevant information, or creating task lists, etc. However, I found the application so comprehensive that without realizing it, I began integrating many work-related aspects into it. Eventually, I decided to implement this application as an additional tool for my entire team, and to this day, I believe it has been an excellent decision. Another aspect that I love is the ease of use on any device. I can quickly access my documents from my laptop or cellphone, and any changes are updated swiftly if I'm using both devices simultaneously. Dislikes: Sometimes I use the app to create work logs or notes for certain projects, so I often add photos to my documents. I usually take the pictures within the application, but it can be quite tedious. Many times, the app becomes very slow when doing this, which is something I dislike the most. Moreover, I don't like that I can't rotate my photos. Sometimes, they are displayed incorrectly, and it's quite inconvenient to view them that way. Another aspect is that when the new AI feature was implemented, I started testing this new tool. However, the free attempts were very limited, not enough to evaluate whether I wanted to purchase the subscription or not. Problems Solved: This app is an all-in-one solution. I can create tables, lists, hold meetings, and write documents. The most incredible feature is that I can add code, and it respects the syntax correctly, that's the most valuable aspect for me. I can include any type of information, including photos and audio. I appreciate the high level of customization it offers, I can easily highlight text and if I want to move a paragraph within a document, I don't need to copy and paste, just dragging it is enough. In my work, Notion has made collaboration very easy, being able to create documents that can contain such a variety of information has allowed us to consolidate all our documentation in one place. The updates are reflected instantly, and it has also helped us to organize ourselves better.

content: Notion - A useful tool in the work of mental health specialists with improvable AI Likes: One of the standout features of Notion is its customizable workspace. I can create databases, templates, and custom dashboards according to my specific needs as a psychologist. Whether setting up a database for client profiles, creating a task tracker for appointments and deadlines, or building a knowledge base on therapeutic techniques, Notion perfectly adapts to my workflow. Collaboration is simple with Notion. I can invite colleagues or clients to collaborate on specific projects, ensuring a smooth focus on teamwork. The real-time editing and commenting features make it easy to provide feedback, share ideas, and keep everyone on the same page. Dislikes: Notion has an integrated AI system that attempts to facilitate and speed up some tasks, such as automatic file classification and tag suggestion. While this feature can be useful in many cases, I have experienced some issues with its accuracy and performance. Sometimes, Notion's AI system can make mistakes when classifying files, resulting in incorrect organization of information. Additionally, I have noticed that the suggested tags may not always be relevant or accurate, which requires manual review and correction on my part. Although I appreciate the incorporation of artificial intelligence in Notion as a promising feature, I hope they continue to improve it to ensure greater accuracy and efficiency in the future. Problems Solved: As a psychologist, I used to have problems with my important information being scattered across different platforms and tools. That's when I discovered Notion, and it has been a complete game-changer for me. Notion has become my preferred solution for consolidating all my notes, documents, and resources in a centralized location. It has eliminated the hassle of switching between multiple applications and searching for information in various places.

content: Notion | Empowering Productivity with Style and Simplicity Likes: Notion excels with its interactive UI that boasts a visually appealing and intuitive design. The user experience is seamless, thanks to easy navigation and convenient drag-and-drop functionality. Its collaboration features are robust, enabling real-time teamwork and fostering efficient workflows. Including an AI writing assistant enhances productivity and ensures refined written content. Additionally, Notion offers a convenient Chrome extension for saving web pages directly to the workspace, streamlining information organisation. Dislikes: Notion has a limitation regarding the lack of freeze columns in tables, which can be a drawback for users working extensively with data who require fixed column headers while scrolling through large tables. Introducing this feature would enhance Notion's functionality for data-driven tasks. Additionally, when multiple users collaborate and manage documents or workspaces, Notion's performance can suffer, leading to slow response times. Although this issue is infrequent, it can be frustrating during critical collaborative efforts. Problems Solved: Notion solves multiple problems by providing a versatile platform for writing PRDs, roadmap planning, note-taking, task tracking, and collaborative work. Its structured approach streamlines the creation of PRDs, while roadmap planning ensures clear project direction. The note-taking feature consolidates ideas and research, and task tracking simplifies project management. Additionally, Notion's AI writing assistant enhances productivity by offering suggestions for improved grammar and clarity, refining written content. This comprehensive toolset greatly benefits my workflow and productivity as a product manager.

content: Notion is a game changer when it comes to AI. Likes: This tool is a game-changer when it comes to planning and organization, and let me tell you, its integration of artificial intelligence takes it to a whole new level. Notion effortlessly combines the power of planning features with the magic of AI, making the whole process a breeze while keeping it professional. One of the standout features of Notion is how it simplifies planning with the help of AI. Dislikes: One area where I've noticed some room for improvement is in the AI's ability to generate creative content. As someone who often creates slogans and catchy phrases, I was excited to see how Notion's AI would assist me in this creative process. However, after using it for a while, I noticed that the AI tends to get a bit repetitive in its suggestions. For example, when brainstorming slogans, I found that the AI would often provide similar variations of the same idea, resulting in a lack of diversity and originality. While the AI's initial suggestions were helpful, it would have been great to see more unique and fresh ideas being generated. Problems Solved: As a creative professional working in an aesthetics company, finding the right tools to streamline my work and enhance productivity is a top priority. One of the primary problems Notion addresses is the scattered nature of information and tasks. Before discovering Notion, I often found myself juggling multiple apps, documents, and sticky notes, which led to inefficiency and confusion. However, Notion's all-in-one workspace consolidates everything I need in one place, providing a centralized hub for planning, note-taking, collaboration, and more.

content: Unique utilities but crashing too frequently Likes: I love the fact that Notion AI has the ability to put words in bold and highlight entire sentences. Additionally, its automatic addition of emojis is a delightful feature. Another aspect that I appreciate is how Notion AI selects appropriate words and emojis for me. By utilizing inputs such as "put important words in bold" or "add related emojis," it accurately identifies the elements that require emphasis or visual representation. These two reasons contribute to my preference for Notion AI over other available AI options. Furthermore, I value the convenience of having a directly accessible feature to "fix spelling and grammar" or "improve writing." Dislikes: The AI feature is experiencing frequent crashes, which disrupt its functionality. Suddenly, it stops performing tasks that it was able to do just moments ago, and error messages like "request body too large" appear, even when working with relatively short paragraphs. Additionally, when attempting to import a developed answer into a Notion page, the application crashes and displays the message "Sorry: that request was too large." Despite the answer being generated, the AI box disappears, and the page reverts to its original state. Problems Solved: Notion AI is helping me save time by making the writing process faster. It also saves me money because I don't need to involve another person in repetitive tasks like adding emojis. Additionally, it allows me to develop content ideas and write more easily.

content: Excellent experience. I recommended it to my friends. Likes: For me, Notion it's a super cool app that can help you stay organized and productive! Notion is like an all-in-one workspace that you can customize to fit your needs, so you can do everything from taking notes to managing tasks. The best part is that it's really easy to use, thanks to its intuitive user interface and handy search function. Not only that, but Notion also lets you collaborate with others in real time, so you can work together with your team no matter where you are. Whether you're a student, freelancer, or part of a company, Notion is a great tool for streamlining your workflows and getting stuff done. Dislikes: Sometimes is slow, specially when I have a lot of tables or database connected. I would like: - To have integration with MS Outlook. - Is not working on analyzing documents yet. - I would like a grease theme (not white or black). Problems Solved: I've been using Notion for a while now, and it has truly been a game-changer for me when it comes to managing my time effectively. One of the features I love is the ability to set due dates for tasks, which has helped me prioritize my work and meet deadlines. Notion's customizable templates, collaboration options, and progress tracking make it an ideal tool for me to stay on top of my schedule. I highly recommend Notion to anyone looking to improve their time management skills. It's a great tool that has helped me stay organized and efficient.

content: The best tool for organize my life (as an ADHD) Likes: Notion is an excellent tool since I can separate my personal life, professional life and other areas. I am a person with ADHD and have trouble creating a plan for a task, so AI notion helps me divide the bigger task into smaller tasks; this help reduces my anxiety. Also, with better organization, I stopped missing appointments and deadline data. Before notion and Notion AI, I struggled to organize several parts of my life. Dislikes: Notion and Notion AI can be slow sometimes because of the emojis, figures, graphs, links and other stuff that lag the visual aspect. This is a problem for me because the pages I create usually have a lot of information, which causes some pages to lag. I have to hide some information to prevent the lag. Problems Solved: With the help of Notion and Notion AI, I have been able to organize several parts of my life. As a teacher and researcher, I have presentations that I need to revise before class. As a researcher, I sometimes need information from several articles, and Notion helps me unify all this information on pages. This has significantly improved, as I no longer miss appointments and deadlines. As a result, I have more time to focus on other areas of my life, such as my hobbies and interests. In addition, I have created a more comprehensive and detailed plan for my daily activities, which has helped me achieve my goals more efficiently. Overall, the use of Notion and Notion AI has positively impacted my life, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to improve their organization and productivity. Also, I am a bad writer, So Notion AI correct the text above.
